articles.description: Anxiety as Nigerians came to learn, yesterday, that the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, currently being administered on citizens had been suspended by no fewer than seven countries for allegedly causing blood clotting and other health hazards.
articles.title: Anxiety as more European nations suspend COVID-19 vaccine - Guardian

articles.content: At least 10 European countries have so far suspended the use of the Oxford University-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine. Denmark, Norway and Iceland halted the use of the vaccine, known as Covishield in I… [+2495 chars]
articles.description: Denmark, the first to announce it was suspending the jab, said that the move was precautionary.
articles.title: AstraZeneca vaccine: Covishield suspended in 10 European countries over reports of blood clot - Moneycontrol

articles.author: Rebecca Robbins, Thomas Erdbrink
articles.content:
Italys suspension of a different batch was tied to a man in Sicily who died after receiving his shot. Its unclear whether a blood clot was involved.
More than 142,000 people in Denmark, which has a … [+1974 chars]
articles.description: Millions of people have received the vaccine without safety problems, and there is no evidence of any causal link between the vaccine and blood clots.
articles.title: European Countries Suspend Use of AstraZeneca Shots Over Worries About Blood Clots - The New York Times

articles.author: Diego Romero, Diego Romero
articles.content:
EDMONTON -- 
Alberta's top doctor continued to vouch for the AstraZeneca vaccine on Thursday after some European countries suspended its use.
Denmark announced it will stop using AstraZeneca for tw… [+1984 chars]
articles.description: Alberta's top doctor continued to vouch for the AstraZeneca vaccine on Thursday after some European countries suspended its use.
articles.title: Alberta's AstraZeneca doses not linked to issues found in Europe: Dr. Hinshaw - CTV Edmonton

articles.author: Andrew Galbraith
articles.content: SHANGHAI (Reuters) - Asian shares rose on Friday after U.S. President Joe Biden signed a $1.9 trillion stimulus bill into law, and after a dovish European Central Bank meeting prompted a retreat in b… [+3266 chars]
articles.description: Asian shares rose on Friday after U.S. President Joe Biden signed a $1.9 trillion stimulus bill into law, and after a dovish European Central Bank meeting prompted a retreat in bond yields and eased global concerns about rising inflation.
articles.title: Asian stocks up on dovish ECB as Biden signs stimulus - Reuters

articles.content: Ontario says it plans to proceed ahead with its rollout of the AstraZeneca vaccine despite reports at least two European countries have suspended its use following reports of blood clots in some peop… [+7884 chars]
articles.description: Ontario says it plans to proceed ahead with its rollout of the AstraZenca vaccine despite reports at least two European countries have suspended its use
articles.title: Ontario to continue AstraZeneca rollout as Denmark, Norway temporarily suspend its use - CityNews Toronto

articles.content:
Football supporters from across Europe have added to the growing concern over Champions League reforms, claiming proposed expansion will cement the dominance of elite clubs in perpetuity.
With just … [+2345 chars]
articles.description: Umbrella body Football Supporters Europe have published a manifesto criticising Uefa’s plans to expand the Champions League
articles.title: Fans across Europe speak out against Champions League expansion - The Guardian

articles.author: CNA
articles.content: BRUSSELS: Europe approved Johnson & Johnson's single dose COVID-19 vaccine on Thursday (Mar 11), paving the way for the first shots to be delivered in a month as the bloc seeks to speed up a stut… [+4238 chars]
articles.description: Europe approved Johnson & Johnson's single dose COVID-19 vaccine on Thursday (Mar 11), paving the way for the first shots to be delivered in a month as the bloc seeks to speed up a stuttering inoculation campaign and boost its supplies.
articles.title: Europe clears Johnson & Johnson's single-shot COVID-19 vaccine - CNA

articles.author: AFP
articles.description: COPENHAGEN: Denmark, Norway and Iceland on Thursday temporarily suspended the use of AstraZeneca’s Covid-19 vaccine over concerns about patients developing post-jab blood clots, as the manufacturer and Europe’s medicines watchdog insisted the vaccine was safe.
articles.title: Denmark, Norway, Iceland suspend use of AstraZeneca vaccine - New Straits Times

articles.description: PARIS — France on Thursday (March 11) eased travel restrictions for seven countries outside the European Union (EU), including Britain, saying trips to and from them would no longer need to be justified by essential reasons.
articles.title: France eases travel rules for seven countries, including Singapore: French foreign ministry - TODAYonline

articles.description: Antoine Griezmann admitted Barcelona were "gutted" after going out of the Champions League in the last 16 on Wednesday, as a 1-1 draw away to Paris Saint-Germain saw the Catalans lose 5-2 on aggregate.
articles.title: Barcelona 'gutted' at earliest European exit in 14 years - SuperSport
